qas.question: What year was Joseph Stalin’s version of the pact published?
What was the Soviet response to the Nazi-Soviet Relations publication
How long did Stalins version of what happened between the Germans and the Soviets last?
What year wasn't Joseph Stalin’s version of the pact published?
What year was Joseph Stalin’s version of the pact unpublished?
What wasn't the Soviet response to the Nazi-Soviet Relations publication
How long didn't Stalins version of what happened between the Germans and the Soviets last?
How long did Stalins version of what happened between the British and the Soviets last?

context: In response to the publication of the secret protocols and other secret German–Soviet relations documents in the State Department edition Nazi–Soviet Relations (<a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>1948<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>), Stalin published <a1_0><b5_0>Falsifiers of History<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which included the claim that, during the Pact's operation, Stalin rejected Hitler's claim to share in a division of the world, without mentioning the Soviet offer to join the Axis. That version persisted, without exception, in historical studies, official accounts, memoirs and textbooks published in the Soviet Union <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>until the Soviet Union's dissolution<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>.
